name: Troy Hunt on Controlling Nissans
description: Troy Hunt goes into controlling Nissan vehicles.

name: Tesla hackers explain how they did it at Defcon
description: Overview of DEFCON 23 presentation on hacking into Tesla cars.

name: Anatomy of the Rolljam Wireless Car Hack
description: Overview of the RollJam rolling code exploitation device.

name: IOActive's Tools and Data
description: Chris Valasek and Charlie Miller release some of their tools and data for hacking into vehicles in an effort to get more people into vehicle security research.

name: Developments in Car Hacking
description: via the SANS Reading Room, Currie's paper analyses the risks and perils of smart vehicle technology.

name: Car Hacking on the Cheap
description: A whitepaper from Chris Valesek and IOActive on hacking your car when you don't have a lot of resources at your disposal.

name: Car Hacking: The definitive source
description: Charlie Miller and Chris Valasek publish all tools, data, research notes, and papers to everyone for free

name: "Hopping on the CAN Bus" from BlackHat Asia 2015
description: A talk from BlackHat Asia 2015 that by the end the audience should "gain an understanding of automotive systems, but will also have the tools to attack them".

name: "Drive It Like You Hacked It" from DEFCON 23
description: A talk and slides from Samy Kamkar's DEFCON 23/2015 talk that includes hacking garages, exploiting automotive mobile apps, and breaking rolling codes to unlock any vehicle with low cost tools.

name: Samy Kamkar on Hacking Vehicles with OnStar
description: Samy Kamkar, the prolific hacker behind the Samy worm on MySpace, explores hacking into vehicles with OnStar systems.

name: Remote Exploitation of an Unaltered Passenger Vehicle
description: DEFCON 23 talk by Chris Valasek and Charlie Miller give their now famous talk on hacking into a Jeep remotely and stopping it dead in its tracks.

name: Adventures in Automotive Networks and Control Units
description: DEFCON 21 talk by Chris Valasek and Charlie Miller on automotive networks.

name: Can You Trust Autonomous Vehicles?
description: DEFCON 24 talk by Jianhao Liu, Chen Yan, Wenyuan Xu

name: Ken Munro & Dave Lodge
description: Hacking the Mitsubishi Outlander & IOT - talk from BSides Manchester 2016 by Ken and Dave of Pen Test Partners

name: A Platform base on Visualization for Protecting CAN Bus Security
description: Syscan360 2016 SH talk by Jianhao Liu

name: Gateway Internals of Tesla Motors
description: Zeronights 2016 talk by Nie Seng and Liu Ling

name: Koscher et al. Experimental Security Analysis of a Modern Automobile, 2010
Comprehensive Experimental Analyses of Automotive Attack Surfaces, 2011
Miller and Valesek
description: Self proclaimed "car hacking the definitve source".

name: Adventures in Automotive Networks and Control Units (aka car hacking)
A Survey of Remote Automotive Attack Surfaces, 2014
Remote Compromise of an Unaltered Passenger Vehicle (aka The Jeep Hack), 2015
Udacity's Self Driving Car Engineer Course
description: The content for Udacity's self driving car software engineer course. The actual course on Udacity's website is here.

name: DEFCON Car Hacking Village
description: Car Hacking exercises from DEFCON 24.

name: canbushack: Hack Your Car
description: course on Vehicle Hacking methodology.

name: OWASP Internet of Things Project
description: OWASP's project to secure IoT, from cars to medical devices and beyond.

name: IAmTheCavalry
description: Global organization backed by major internet companies pushing standards to secure IoT devices.

name: Carloop Community
description: Community of people interested in car hacking and connecting vehicles to the cloud.

name: The Cyber Security Automotve Summit
description: A conference dedicated to automotive cyber security involving most of the big players on this aspect.

name: escar conference
description: Embedded security in cars.

name: TrustedSec Podcast
description: From the people at TrustedSec, leaders in Social Engineering, their episodes often go into recent vehicle vulnerabilities and exploits.

name: SANS Internet Storm Center
description: the ISC run a regular podcast going into the latest vulnerabilities and security news.

name: Security Ledger
description: A podcast focusing on interviewing security experts about topics related to security.

name: Big Bugs Podcast Episode 1: Auto Bugs
description: Critical Vulns found in Cars with Jason Haddix - Jason Haddix explores major vulnerabilities found in cars.

name: Hacking Under the Hood and Into Your Car
description: Chris Valasek and Charlie Miller discuss with NPR how they were able to hack into vehicles.

name: Hacking Connected Vehicles with Chris Valasek of IOActive
description: Chris Valasek talks about hacking into connected vehicles.

name: Open Vehicle Monitoring System
description: A community project building a hardware module for your car, a server to talk to it, and a mobile app to talk to the server, in order to allow developers and enthusiasts to add more functionality to their car and control it remotely.

name: Open Source Car Control Project
description: The Open Source Car Control Project is a hardware and software project detailing the conversion of a late model vehicle into an autonomous driving research and development vehicle.

name: CANtact
description: "The Open Source Car Tool" designed to help you hack your car. You can buy one or make your own following the guide here.

name: Freematics OBD-II Telematics Kit
description: Arduino-based OBD-II Bluetooth adapter kit has both an OBD-II device and a data logger, and it comes with GPS, an accelerometer and gyro, and temperature sensors.

name: GoodThopter12
description: Crafted by a well-known hardware hacker, this board is a general board that can be used for exploration of automotive networks.

name: USB2CAN
description: Cheap USB to CAN connector that will register a device on linux that you can use to get data from a CAN network.

name: Intrepid Tools
description: Expensive, but extremely versatile tools specifically designed for reversing CAN and other vehicle communication protocols.

name: Red Pitaya
description: Replaces expensive measurement tools such as oscilloscopes, signal generators, and spectrum analyzers. Red Pitaya has LabView and Matlab interfaces, and you can write your own tools and applications for it. It even supports extensions for things like Arduino shields.

name: ChipWhisperer
description: A system for side-channel attacks, such as power analysis and clock glitching.

name: HackerSDR
description: A Software Defined Radio peripheral capable of transmission or reception of radio signals from 1 MHz to 6 GHz. Designed to enable test and development of modern and next generation radio technologies.

name: Carloop
description: Open source development kit that makes it easy to connect your car to the Internet. Lowest cost car hacking tool that is compatible with SocketCAN and can-utils.  No OBD-II to serial cable required.

name: CANBadger
description: A tool for reverse-engineering and testing automotive systems. The CANBadger consists of both hardware and software. The main interface is a LPC1768/LPC1769 processor mounted on a custom PCB, which offers two CAN interfaces, SD Card, a blinky LED, some GPIO pins, power supply for peripherals and the ethernet port.

name: CANSPY
description: A platform giving security auditors to audit CAN devices. It can be used to block, forward or modify CAN frames on the fly autonomously as well as interactively.

name: CANBus Triple
description: General purpose Controller Area Network swiss army knife and development platform.

name: USBtin
description: USBtin is a simple USB to CAN interface. It can monitor CAN busses and transmit CAN messages. USBtin implements the USB CDC class and creates a virtual comport on the host computer.

name: Macchina M2
description: Macchina 2.0 is a complete overhaul of our 1.X generation of Macchina. The goals are still the same: Create an easy-to-use, fully-open, and super-compatible automotive interface.

name: Kayak
description: Java application for CAN bus diagnosis and monitoring.

name: UDSim
description: GUI tool that can monitor a CAN bus and automatically learn the devices attached to it by watching communications.

name: RomRaider
description: An open source tuning suite for the Subaru engine control unit that lets you view and log data and tune the ECU.

name: O2OO
description: Works with the ELM327 to record data to a SQLite database for graphing purposes. It also supports reading GPS data. You can connect this to your car and have it map out using Google Maps KML data where you drive.

name: CANToolz
description: CANToolz is a framework for analysing CAN networks and devices. It is based on several modules which can be assembled in a pipeline.

name: BUSMASTER -An Open Source tool to simulate, analyze and test data bus systems such as CAN, LIN, FlexRay.
openalpr
description: An open source Automatic License Plate Recognition library written in C++ with bindings in C#, Java, Node.js, Go, and Python.

name: metasploit
description: The popular metasploit framework now supports Hardware Bridge sessions, that extend the framework's capabilites onto hardware devices such as socketcan and SDR radios.

name: SocketCAN Utils
description: Userspace utilites for SocketCAN on Linux.

name: vircar
description: a Virtual car userspace that sends CAN messages based on SocketCAN

name: Caring Caribou
description: Intended to be the nmap of vehicle security.

name: c0f
description: A fingerprinting tool for CAN communications that can be used to find a specific signal on a CAN network when testing interactions with a vehicle.

name: Python-CAN
description: Python interface to various CAN implementations, including SocketCAN. Allows you to use Python 2.7.x or 3.3.x+ to communicate over CAN networks.

name: CANNiBUS
description: A Go server that allows a room full of researchers to simultaneously work on the same vehicle, whether for instructional purposes or team reversing sessions.

name: CAN Simulator
description: A Go based CAN simulator for the Raspberry Pi to be used with PiCAN2 or the open source CAN Simulator board

name: NodeJS extension to SocketCAN
description: Allows you to communicate over CAN networks with simple JavaScript functions.

name: UberATC
description: Uber Advanced Technologies Center - info@uberatc.com.

name: Tesla
description: Tesla hires security professionals for a variety of roles, particularly securing their vehicles.

name: Intrepid Control Systems
description: Embedded security company building tools for reversing vehicles.

name: Rapid7
description: Rapid7 does work in information, computer, and embedded security.

name: IOActive
description: Security consulting firm that does work on pentesting hardware and embedded systems.

name: General Motors on HackerOne
description: responsible disclosure submissions accepted

name: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles on Bugcrowd
description: responsible disclosure submissions accepted

name: Tesla Motors on Bugcrowd
description: submissions accepted, paid bounties offered
